triples.name: Symmetry breaking
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates continuous symmetry breaking as a fundamental phenomenon in the XY model realization.

triples.name: Classical XY model
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel realization of a two-dimensional dipolar XY model using Rydberg atoms.

triples.name: Rydberg atom
triples.relevance: Rydberg atoms are used as the physical platform for implementing the programmable quantum simulator.

triples.name: Quantum simulator
triples.relevance: The paper realizes a programmable Rydberg quantum simulator to study XY model physics.

triples.name: Goldstone boson
triples.relevance: Goldstone modes control thermodynamic stability in the ordered phase of the XY ferromagnet.

triples.name: Ferromagnetism
triples.relevance: The paper characterizes long-range XY ferromagnetic order enabled by dipolar interactions.

triples.name: Antiferromagnetism
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates adiabatic preparation of low-temperature states of the XY antiferromagnet.

triples.name: Ising model
triples.relevance: Recent Rydberg work on discrete spin rotation symmetry using Ising interactions complements this XY continuous symmetry work.
